mods.abstract: Female adult, cloth head and all body, painted features, black yarn hair, full length dress, embroidered plate on bodice front, four panels of skirt decorated with different color threads, dress sleeves cover hands, shorter sleeve satin jacket with embroidery decoration, cone shaped red hat with one golden coin and white veil, all are machine and hand-made. Accompanying information describes as costume of the women of Bethlehem. The phylactery worn on the head piece is a reminder to the person to keep the law (Deut.VI:8 XI:18), or it might be a charm or safeguard. It is often worn by Jewish women today.
mods.accessCondition: Please submit an LSU Special Collections reference ticket at https://askus.lib.lsu.edu/special for any questions or comments about this digital object.

recordInfo.recordOrigin: Transformed into MODS from extended Dublin Core by the LDL Development Team at Louisiana State University.
